snippet.title: Uber under fire from regulators and competitors in Chicago
snippet.description: ...Uber, a startup that allows you to hail a car from your smartphone, is facing a fresh round of legal trouble, this time in Chicago. snippet.title: Week in Science: it's cold in Chicago edition
snippet.description: ...The biggest happening in science this past week was the annual meeting of the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS). AAAS is the world's largest scientific society, and John Timmer, Tim De Chant, and I braved the freezing cold of Chicago in February (and the total lack...

snippet.title: Liquid cooling startup Iceotope talks about the basics of its business
snippet.description: ...Iceotope has developed an efficient liquid cooling technology that allows supercomputers and data centers in the UK, and even in hot equatorial regions, to run as efficiently as those based the Arctic Circle. Iceotope's system was modeled using computational fluid dynamics, and eliminates the need for air conditioning units and fans to carry heat away. Wired.co.uk spoke to founder Peter Hopt...

snippet.title: Ars goes to the Chicago Auto Show
snippet.description: ...The Chicago Auto Show bills itself as the "nation's largest auto show." There's certainly room for it to be the largest show of its kind in the US, as it takes place in McCormick Place, which is the largest convention center in North America. And the Chicago Auto Show is definitely big, using 1 million square feet of McCormick Place's 2.7 million square feet of available...
